  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Delivery Officer",
  "description": "Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone.

Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Delivery Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Alaba International, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	As the Logistics Assistant, you will work closely with the Logistics manager to plan, manage and facilitate the overall supply chain needs/requirements of the company including handling deliveries across all locations and branches, liaising with logistics companies/vendors, managing stocks, and other fleet concerns to deliver products on deadlines.
	You will be charged with the responsibility assisting with running the store-keepingand stock management of the products shipment, assembled and materials/parts received into the warehouse.


Responsibilities


	Strategic planning and management of logistics, warehouse, transportation and customer service with other inventory team.
	Assist the Logistics Manager in overseeing and monitoring of quality, quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs, and efficiency.
	Organizing warehouse, categorizing goods, planning routes, and assist in processing shipments.
	Proper checking of goods to identify defectives
	Resolving delivery inconsistencies or delay.
	Optimize transportation routes to minimize costs and maximize efficiency.
	Assist in planning and scheduling shipments to ensure timely delivery to customers.
	Assist in overseeing the movement, storage, and distribution of goods or materials.
	Taking care of inquiries or compliance issues related to shipping or transportation matters.
	Ensuring that shipping documents are well kept, updated, and in compliance. Examples include cost statements/ receipt, stock counts, delivery of products, product delivery and shipment documents,etc.
	Assist intracking, receiving, and stocking all items ordered.
	Ensure materials are appropriately stored.
	Working proactively with the cashier in ensuring and realizing efficiencyin inventory management.
	Communicate with carriers, suppliers, and customers to resolve issues and ensure smooth operation


Qualifications


	SSCE, GCE, NECO
	Must know how to drive with a valid driver license.
	Good knowledge of Lagos road is very important
	At least 2 years of proven experience as a Delivery Officer
	Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
	Great commercial and business understanding
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Record of successful distribution and logistics management
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects.
	High computer literacy is an advantage.
	Must reside around the job location (Alaba)
	Candidates residing around Ojo, Mile 2, Alakija orAbule Ado are advised to apply.


Other Requirements (Behavioral):


	Teamwork &ndash; Ability to work within a diverse team with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multitaskeffectively.
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.


Salary
N100,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;salpha@salphaenergy.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location (Alaba) as the subject of the mail.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Delivery Officer
Job Location: Alaba International, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	As the Logistics Assistant, you will work closely with the Logistics manager to plan, manage and facilitate the overall supply chain needs/requirements of the company including handling deliveries across all locations and branches, liaising with logistics companies/vendors, managing stocks, and other fleet concerns to deliver products on deadlines.
	You will be charged with the responsibility assisting with running the store-keepingand stock management of the products shipment, assembled and materials/parts received into the warehouse.


Responsibilities


	Strategic planning and management of logistics, warehouse, transportation and customer service with other inventory team.
	Assist the Logistics Manager in overseeing and monitoring of quality, quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs, and efficiency.
	Organizing warehouse, categorizing goods, planning routes, and assist in processing shipments.
	Proper checking of goods to identify defectives
	Resolving delivery inconsistencies or delay.
	Optimize transportation routes to minimize costs and maximize efficiency.
	Assist in planning and scheduling shipments to ensure timely delivery to customers.
	Assist in overseeing the movement, storage, and distribution of goods or materials.
	Taking care of inquiries or compliance issues related to shipping or transportation matters.
	Ensuring that shipping documents are well kept, updated, and in compliance. Examples include cost statements/ receipt, stock counts, delivery of products, product delivery and shipment documents,etc.
	Assist intracking, receiving, and stocking all items ordered.
	Ensure materials are appropriately stored.
	Working proactively with the cashier in ensuring and realizing efficiencyin inventory management.
	Communicate with carriers, suppliers, and customers to resolve issues and ensure smooth operation


Qualifications


	SSCE, GCE, NECO
	Must know how to drive with a valid driver license.
	Good knowledge of Lagos road is very important
	At least 2 years of proven experience as a Delivery Officer
	Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
	Great commercial and business understanding
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Record of successful distribution and logistics management
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects.
	High computer literacy is an advantage.
	Must reside around the job location (Alaba)
	Candidates residing around Ojo, Mile 2, Alakija orAbule Ado are advised to apply.


Other Requirements (Behavioral):


	Teamwork – Ability to work within a diverse team with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multitaskeffectively.
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.

N100,000 per month.

Admin Personnel (Female) Job at OPPO




        
    

        
        OPPO, is one of the world’s leading innovators in smart devices and mobile technology. With operations in over 60 countries and regions,Dedicated to delivering cutting-edge innovation, premium user experiences, and stylish designs. OPPO continues to expand its footprint with over 290,000 points of sale and 1,900 official service centers — bringing the beauty of technology closer to people every day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin Personnel (Female)
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate records, including personnel files, attendance, and administrative documents.
	Schedule and coordinate appointments, meetings, events, and travel arrangements.
	Process expense reports and track budgets in compliance with company policies.
	Maintain and organize both physical and digital filing systems.
	Provide general office support such as photocopying, scanning, and document management.
	Monitor and replenish office supplies, equipment, and facility needs.
	Assist in planning and coordinating events and special projects.
	Perform other administrative duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field.
	1–3years of administrative experience.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Attention to detail with excellent communication abilities.
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks efficiently.
	Female is preferred for Gende Balance


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cvpool2021@oppo-aed.ng using "Admin Personnel (Female)" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates residing near Ogba will be contacted.
